title-part.text: MODULATION

reference.text: measuring, testing G01R; masers, lasers H01S; modulators specially adapted for use in the amplifiers H03F3/38; modulating pulses H03K7/00; so-called modulators capable only of a switching between predetermined states of amplitude, frequency or phase H03K17/00, H04L; coding, decoding or code conversion, in general H03M; synchronous modulators specially adapted for colour television H04N9/65

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers only modulation, keying, or interruption of sinusoidal oscillations or electromagnetic waves, the modulating signal having any desired waveform.
In this subclass, circuits usable both as modulator and demodulator are classified in the group dealing with the type of modulator involved.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
H03C1/38 - H03C1/44 covered by H03C1/36
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.
